Nominated by the 8th-grade team, Stephanie Flores Aquilar has won the DAR Award.

Stephanie is a model student, as well as a model human. She arrives in all history classes, whether in person or through distance learning, intent on learning and staying positive. Her hard work and positive attitude are an inspiration to everyone. Additionally, these trying times of social distancing and Chromebook classrooms have not dampened her spirits or dedication to learning. Despite being ahead with the discussion topics in her independent work, she has not missed a single online meeting for her history class, and actively participates in every lesson. It was my pleasure to nominate Stephanie for this award. I know she will exhibit greatness in all her future endeavors.

For more information on the DAR Award, please see the letter from Catherine Grohocki, DAR Excellence in American History Award Chair.

We are pleased to announce that Mr. Michael Podeszwa has officially been selected as the Principal of the Winthrop STEM Elementary Magnet School.

Mr. Podeszwa is well known to the school community and is a highly respected New London Public Schools educator. With over twenty years of service to the district, Michael began his teaching career in New London as an elementary teacher and has served as a head teacher, a summer school director, an assistant principal, an interim principal, and will now lead Winthrop STEM Elementary Magnet School as its next Principal. He will officially start as principal on July 1st.

Please join us in congratulating Mr. Podeszwa as the Principal of Winthrop STEM Elementary Magnet School!

May 1st is “National School Lunch Hero Day” all across America. This is an opportunity to show our appreciation for the staffs’ dedication, and shed light on all of their hard work for the students of New London. We want to celebrate our team not only today, or during the time of this pandemic, but celebrate them for what they do for our students each and every day of the year. Our staffs’ commitment to giving the students the best possible meal every day is nothing short of remarkable. They have answered every call during this unknown time, have done it with a smile on their face, incredible teamwork, and most importantly, with the well-being of our students in mind. Today we want to scream “THANK YOU” and say how proud we are of our team. Today is their day to be recognized and celebrated!!! So to all of our New London Child Nutrition Program Staff we say…”THANK YOU!!!!” And if you see a school bus driving around town today, give them a honk and show them some NL love!!

New London Public Schools and First Student would like to update you on our latest transportation news.

We are in the process of building the FirstView Parent App to assist parents and guardians with real-time transportation updates. This new app will be released in January 2020 and will offer families helpful features including estimated bus arrival times, opt-in district messaging regarding delays or issues, customizable alerts for when the bus is at a chosen distance or number of minutes away, secure password protection and built-in customer support. It’s also available in 10 languages to better meet the needs of our users. Information for the App will be distributed in the following weeks. This will include an Informational Flyer, a Parent-App Startup-Guide, and Parent App FAQs.

The attached flyer lists the necessary contact information for all of your transportation concerns and questions.

In addition to the attached, please reach out to me, Julian Wilson at 860-439-7878 / Cell 860-501-5909 for further information.
